body:
This issue is occurred at 6.8.5

possible related to this PR: https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/pull/2899

issue.title: Typescript error if FormValues does not contain any nested attributes.
issue.body:
## Reproduction

[https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-usetypedcontroller-forked-hdzbr?file=/src/App.tsx]( https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-usetypedcontroller-forked-hdzbr?file=/src/App.tsx)

This was created by forking the offical example and updating all versions to the latest

## Issue

Line 32 has error

```
 Types of parameters 'name' and 'name' are incompatible.
            Type 'string' is not assignable to type '"uncontrolled" | "controlled" | "error"'.
```

If you uncomment lines `23-26` the example will work as expected.

## Expected behaviour

Nested attributes should not be a requirement when using @hookform/strictly-typed and typescript

issue.title: ESlint TypeScript error `unbound-method`

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: ðŸ“‹ React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Deconstructing `register` from `useForm` triggers `@typescript-eslint` error [`unbound-method`](https://github.com/typescript-eslint/typescript-eslint/blob/v4.1.0/packages/eslint-plugin/docs/rules/unbound-method.md)

**To Reproduce**
Use ESlint with a rule mentioned above.

**Codesandbox link (Required)**
CodeSandbox does not support ESlint (https://github.com/codesandbox/codesandbox-client/issues/1933)

**Expected behavior**
`register` is not a method that depends on `this` context, so should not trigger a warning. **`handleSubmit` doesn't**.

**Screenshots**
![Screenshot from 2020-09-11 15-40-37](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2625371/92932609-673a0d80-f445-11ea-9a57-7113edc2ded8.png)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**

- OS: btw, I use Arch (not really, Manjaro)
- Browser Vivaldi
- Version up to date
:P

**Additional context**
Similar problem with Formik: https://github.com/formium/formik/issues/2589

*PR welcome? I can contribute*

issue.body:
Part of the solution for #2887

Refactor for only methods unrelated to `Control` type + test for a bug in v6.8.5 from #3002

issue.title: fix controller type argument inference

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: ðŸ“‹ React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body:
This is my attempt to fix #3500 (there is a motivation behind these changes)

* replaced all `TControl` with `FieldValues` + `Control<FV>` combination
* removed `FieldValuesFromControl` type since now `FieldValues` are used directly and no need to infer them from `(T)Control`

TODO (need help or yes/no)

- [ ] how to test these changes? Since this bug doesn't appear in dev, but it can be reproduced locally if types are imported from `./dist` instead of `./src`
- [x] there are multiple bugs fixed by the TControl solution, if anyone remembers the issues I'd check them out for possible regression

**Update:** I found 3 more mentions of this bug so far: #2700 #2984 #3002
All of them with no such error on this revision: https://codesandbox.io/s/crazy-moon-kh79k

PS: branch name should be `controller-generics-contravariance` :P
